com.robinpowered.sdk

Class RobinApi

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.robinpowered.sdk.RobinApi

  • public class RobinApi
extends Object
    A client for interfaces with the Robin API.

    The API is split into several services. A particular service can be obtained by calling getService(ServiceInterface.class). For example getService(AccountService.class).

    Each service requires a valid Credential, typically an AccessTokenCredential. A valid API token may be obtained from the Web Dashboard.

    An optional HTTP Client may be provided to perform network requests, however if none is provided a OkClient will be used, which simply wraps the OkHttpClient.

    Example usage: 

      Credential credential = new AccessTokenCredential("my token");
 RobinApi apiClient = new RobinApi(credential);

 ApiResponse<List<Presence>> presence = apiClient.getService(PlacesService.class).getPresence(mySpaceId).getData();
